original: Bobeck, Carl Filip, överingenjör, Borås, f. 28/3/88 i Fildpstad av f-abr. Carl Wilhelm B. o. Wilhelmina Ericsson. G. 18 m. Kerstin Sundeli. Barn: Wilhelm f. 20, Stina o. Ulla ff. 22. –Mog:ex. v. norra real i Sthlm 05, civ:ing:ex. v. KTH 09. Res. t. Norge, Danm., Finl., Frankr., Engl., Tyskl., Ryssl. o. Bortre Ind. Drifts-ing:assist. v. stat. vattenf :verk, Troll-hätte kraftverk, 09-15, distr :ing. i Skara-distr. 16-17, konsult, ing. v. elektr. prövn:anst. i Sthlm 17-19, förest. f. kraftstat :byrån v. ASEA i Västerås 20-26, f. elektrotekn. avd. v. A-B Vattenbyggn :byråns o. Messrs Rendel, Palmer & Tritton’s gemens, hydroelektr. kont. i London 27-30, därv. konsult, ing. f. den elektr. ut-rustn. f. ett större kraftv :system å Malackahalvön, konsult, ing. v. A-B Vattenbyggn :byrån i Sthlm 30-35, tf. övering. v. Borås elverk 35-36, övering. där sed. 36. Ordf. i Tekn. förb. i Borås 41-45, led. av Sv. tekn:fören.
translated: Bobeck, Carl Filip, chief engineer, Borås, born March 28th, 1888 in Fildpstad to factory worker Carl Wilhelm B. and Wilhelmina Ericsson. Married Kerstin Sundeli in 1918. Children: Wilhelm born in 1920, Stina and Ulla born in 1922. Bobeck received his Mog:ex (secondary school final exam) from Norra Real in Stockholm in 1905, and his civ:ing:ex (civil engineering degree) from KTH in 1909. He traveled to Norway, Denmark, Finland, France, England, Germany, Russia, and the Far East for work. He worked as a engineering assistant at Trollhätte Power Plant from 1909-1915, district engineer in the Skaraborg district from 1916-1917, a consultant engineer at an electrical testing institution in Stockholm from 1917-1919, head of the power station bureau at ASEA in Västerås from 1920-1926, head of the electrical engineering department at A-B Vattenbyggnadsbyrån and Messrs Rendel, Palmer & Tritton's joint hydroelectric office in London from 1927-1930, and an electrical engineering consultant for a major power system on the Malayan Peninsula as well as a consultant engineer at A-B Vattenbyggnadsbyrån in Stockholm from 1930-1935. He was acting chief engineer at Borås power plant in 1935-1936, and has been chief engineer there since 1936. He was chairman of the Technical Association in Borås from 1941-1945 and a member of the Swedish Engineers Association.

worksFor.name: A-B Vattenbyggnadsbyråns and Messrs Rendel, Palmer & Tritton's Joint Hydroelectric Office
